Name: TimeHorizonSegmenter
Archetype: Multi-bucket temporal classification with rule-based precedence
Purpose: Classify each of the user’s financial goals into time-horizon buckets and derive an overall investment time profile for investor profile mapping.
Deliverables: A goal-to-horizon map: list of { goal_id, goal_type, target_amount_estimate, target_date_or_range, horizon_bucket ∈ [short_term, medium_term, long_term], priority_level } plus an aggregate { dominant_horizon, horizon_mix_vector, conflict_flags } where conflict_flags capture inconsistencies (e.g., long-term return expectations for short-term goals).
Strengths: Clear separation of goals by time; identifies when a single risk preference is being incorrectly applied across incompatible horizons; surfaces trade-offs between short-term access and long-term growth; useful for beginners who have multiple vague goals by forcing explicit temporal classification.
Watch-out: Failure when user cannot specify any timing information or only provides qualitative aspirations with no temporal anchors; degrades if asked to choose specific products (e.g., which account type or asset) instead of just time buckets; must not discuss budgeting, user-interface design, financial education content, or optimization of contribution amounts beyond what is needed to classify horizons.
